medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced intermittent abdominal pain over the past month, but this current episode began suddenly yesterday evening in the suprapubic region. The pain has not migrated, does not radiate, and has been more severe than prior instances. The patient vomited once, which she attributes to pain and reflux rather than nausea. No diarrhea was reported, with the last bowel movement being normal this morning.
medical_history.past_medical_history: GERD, lactose intolerance, IBS, sleep monoclonus, tension migraines
